metadata.title: French Colonial Sailors and Technological Knowledge in the Union Française
metadata.journal_or_publisher: The Institute of French Studies at New York University and the Minda de Gunzburg Center for European Studies at Harvard University

relevance.topic: Labor displacement due to technological change in the French shipping industry
relevance.relevance: The study is relevant as it examines the displacement of African sailors due to the transition from steam to diesel ships, highlighting issues of race, skill, and technological change.

design.sample_characteristics: French colonial sailors from West, Equatorial, and East Africa

independent_variables: Transition from steam to diesel ships

dependent_variables.displaced: African sailors were laid off due to technological changes.
dependent_variables.unemployment_or_underemployment: High levels of unemployment among African sailors in Marseille.

text_fragments: 'I have the honor to … draw your attention,' Hyacinthe Gomis wrote to the Bouches-du-Rhône prefect in 1954, 'to the misery and the difficult situation in which a large number of AOF and AEF men find themselves.'
'ONLY THE TRUTH MATTERS,' the organization wrote in all caps, they were being excluded 'BECAUSE THEY ARE BLACK.'
qualitative_data.narrative_descriptions: The study describes how African sailors were displaced due to the transition from steam to diesel ships, and how they contested the racialized assumptions about their skills and expertise.

technological_changes: Transition from steam to diesel ships
historical_context.economic_conditions: Post-World War II modernization and economic reconstruction in France.
historical_context.institutional_context: French colonial policies and the civilizing mission ideology.

outcomes.main_findings: African sailors were displaced due to the transition from steam to diesel ships, and they contested the racialized assumptions about their skills and expertise.
outcomes.conclusions: The study concludes that technological change was used as a pretext for racial discrimination, and African sailors' expertise was undervalued due to racial biases.
outcomes.long_term_impacts: Many displaced sailors found work in other industries, contributing to the postwar economic development of France.

quality_assessment.methodological_limitations: The study relies on historical documents and letters, which may not capture the full scope of experiences.
quality_assessment.coherence: The study provides a coherent narrative linking technological change to labor displacement and racial discrimination.
quality_assessment.adequacy_of_data: The study uses a rich collection of historical documents and letters to support its findings.
quality_assessment.relevance: The study is highly relevant to understanding the impact of technological change on labor displacement, especially in a colonial context.
